UserObject.label:
HR is responsible for hiring new employees. Cody Engine running in prototyping mode (default mode), adds each new user (employee in this case) as a persona. You can sign in as a specific persona on the Cody Engine dashboard.

1. Select the "Hire Employee" feature frame. 

2. Run Cody.

3. Switch to Cody Engine in your browser (http://localhost:4200)

4. Click on "Employees" in the left sidebar.

5. Click on the "Hire Employee" button and enter some test data. Assign the role "HR" to the first test employee.

6. Wait until the new employee is visible in the list. This takes some time, because in prototyping mode the persona needs to be created.

mxCell.value:
Move "HR" card close to 
"Employees" card 
AFTER you've hired 
at least one Employee 
with the "HR" role 
assigned.

"Run Cody" again.

This will activate the
permission system, so
that only "HR" can hire
more Employees.

Once you've activated the
permission system, you
have to sign in as a
persona with "HR" role, 
if you want to hire another
employee.

This can be done from the
Cody Engine Dashboard.

UserObject.label:
Project Managers (role: PM) are responsible for managing clients and their projects. If a new client was acquired, the PM can add that information to the Time Tracking App.

1. Select the "Acquire Client" feature frame. 

2. Run Cody.

3. Switch to Cody Engine in your browser (http://localhost:4200)

4. Hire another employee with a "PM" role.

5. Sign in as the PM persona.

6. Click "Clients" in the left sidebar.

7. Click "Acquire Client" button and enter a test client.

Welcome   

nice to meet you here on the board! 

Eager to learn how prooph board and Cody can bridge the gap between design and prototyping to shorten the feedback-loop? 

Alright, let's start. you'll find a Big Picture Event Storming below. We want to create a prototype of a time tracking application together. The app will be used by a software agency that works for different clients in multiple projects. Project Managers want to have an overview of the time spent on each project, while HR department wants to keep an eye on the work time of each employee.

As we learned from the Big Picture Event Storming above, the Time Tracking App is used by people with different roles. So the first step is to tell Cody Engine about those roles.

1. Select the "Common" feature frame. Please note that a frame can only be selected at its border. See the wiki for details.

2. Right click on the feature (again near its border) and choose "Cody Wizard" from the context menu.

3. Click the button "Run Cody" in the bottom right corner of the Cody Wizard Dialog

Project Managers (role: PM) also set up client projects in Time Tracking App.

1. Select the "Set Up Client Project" feature.

2. Run Cody.

3. Switch to Cody Engine in your browser (http://localhost:4200)

4. Click "Projects" in the left sidebar.

5. Click "Set Up Client Project" button and enter a test project.

To complete a project set up, Project Managers (role: PM) have to assign developers to a project.

1. Select the "Assign Developer To Project" feature.

2. Run Cody.

3. Switch to Cody Engine in your browser (http://localhost:4200)

4. Hire two developers.
(Hint: if you activated permission system for Employees feature, sign in as the HR persona)

5. Click "Projects" in the left sidebar.

6. Click on the test project in project list.

7. Click on the "Assign Developer to Project" button.

8. Assign at least one developer to the project.

Now we can add the possibility to track time for a specific project.

1. Select the "Track Project Time" feature.

2. Run Cody.

3. Switch to Cody Engine in your browser (http://localhost:4200)

4. Sign in as a developer persona who is assigned to the test project.

5. Click "Timesheet" in the left sidebar.

6. Click on "Track Project Time" button.

7. Enter time tracking data.

The HR department wants to keep an eye on the time tracked by an employee.

1. Run Cody for the "View Employee Time Report" feature.

2. Switch to Cody Engine in your browser (http://localhost:4200)

3. Sign in as HR persona.

4. Navigate to Empoyees -> developer empoyee.

5. You should see a new "Employee Time Report" on the Employee Details page of the developer.

The Time Tracking App should help PMs to keep an overview of the time tracked on a project. 

1. Run Cody for the "View Project Time Report" feature.

2. Switch to Cody Engine in your browser (http://localhost:4200)

3. Sign in as Project Manager persona.

4. Navigate to the test project.

5. You should see a new "Project Time Report" on the Project Details page of the test project.

Set Up Cody Engine   

Cody Engine is a prototyping and lowcode system.

It will bring the Continuous Event Storming design to life!

System requirements and installation instructions can be found here:

https://wiki.prooph-board.com/cody_engine/introduction.html#installation

Check that Cody Engine is running at: http://localhost:4200





If you need help with the set up, just open an issue in the Cody Engine Repository

hotSpot.label: Hint: Sometimes Cody Engine shows an error after code generation, see Troubleshooting section in the wiki.

UserObject.label:
Let Cody do the magic   

Cody Wizard assists you in Event Map Design

It can communicate with Cody to pass your design to the coding bot.

You can access Cody Wizard by selecting an element and open it from the context menu:

https://wiki.prooph-board.com/cody_wizard/introduction.html#access-cody-wizard
